intro: Peristrophe longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf peristrophe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
